website_summaries.verdict: Regardless of what you need to soak up, this 12-pack of absorbent socks will allow you to do it effectively and affordably.
pros: A great value, as this pack offers 12 absorbent socks capable of soaking up 21 gallons total for a surprisingly reasonable price
Eco-friendly, as they are made with some recycled materials
cons: The brand may be less familiar than others on our list, but this isn't a reflection on the quality

customer_reviews.title: Great solution that saves time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Enclosed my patio. Bad news—when it rains one corner of the patio leaks water because the yard of the condo next door is slightly up hill from my patio. Using towels to stop the flow was a Big job and I worried about wet base boards. Then I discovered these “socks”. While the water accumulated in the socks must be removed after a long and hard rain, that is a lot better than watching towels become saturated, replace with dry towels, carry wet towels in a bucket to the dry dryer, then repeat. It rains in Texas.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for ground water
customer_reviews.text: I never knew they made such a product. We had record breaking rain last spring and my rental house basement had a lot of ground water coming in (first time ever). After continuing to mop daily I found these to put around the perimeter of the basement. They effectively held the water so it did not spread & continue to peel up the paint on the concrete floor. I was able to wring them out and lay on my deck for them to dry out and was able to re-use them. Would also be great for putting around a sump crock during a power outage. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We have water that seeps into our basement during heavy rains. These socks worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sam Wise

customer_reviews.title: Can’t soak up enough water.
customer_reviews.text: Torrential rains here in North Texas and needed to soak up pooled rainwater near a French drain to help prevent Mosquitoes from developing. Product only soaked up a minimal amount of water and did not help contain the water as hoped. They have been hanging on the fence for days to dry and are still wet. Thought perhaps they could be reused but it appears not. Appears not environmentally friendly, can’t recycle.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Kidd

customer_reviews.title: THEY WORK!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: THEY WORK!!!!!! I use in my basement & my bucket carrying days are over!!!! We have had a very strange & unusual weather pattern lately, so as I am very near Tennessee River, my basement started pouring in water from the flooded grounds!! These are wonderful!!! I turn them over when one side is full & just let them stay & dry. The only thing to note is that you will need to wear gloves. The silicone filler is sticky when it's wet. BUT, THEY WORK SO WELL!!!!! THANK YOU, AMAZON!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patinal

customer_reviews.title: Holds quite a bit of water. Just not very ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds quite a bit of water. Just not very clear on how to dry it for multiple uses. I tried hanging them to dry, but after a week they are still heavy.
customer_reviews.author: rmch

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WHAT!??????...this product was great for my situation and now you have the NERVE to not have it again!!!!!!!!!....I need more....what am I going to do?!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shang

customer_reviews.title: No Absorbency
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The replacement tubes were just as awful. Will not order again. I saw a previous review about this product and it said it was filled with foam and not any absorbent gel. I bought this product before and it was filled with absorbent gel and worked great. Well this new batch is exactly what a previous reviewer wrote it's awful and does not absorb anything. It's filled with foam and no kind of gel absorbency I would give it zero stars if I could. I asked for a replacement order and we'll see if I get the same thing if I do back it goes. I'll update this review if that's the case.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Jones

customer_reviews.title: These are worthless
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use these to redirect water in my basement to the drain. They don't stop water at all. When water comes up against them it seeps through in just a couple of minutes. In some ways it's worse with them - they soak up water and hold it - for days & days. Then they seep it out. I just used the last two. Water is crawling across the floor from some outside seepage - it hits the SOCK and within 2 minutes there is water on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbant Reusable
customer_reviews.text: I have an enclosed porch with a concrete floor that slopes toward my house. When it rains the floor floods. I bought these to put around the sides & doors of the porch to absorb the water. They work great. After the rain stops I hang them over my porch railing they dry & are ready for the next rain.
customer_reviews.author: E. jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: These used to be awesome. I bought them 4 times and this last time I got them they were completely different. They seem to be made out of a different material and the filling doesn't work as well. The first three times ingot them they were filled with some kind of gel that worked great. Now they have some kind of foam filling and they don't work as well. It's a shame this product sent from 5 stars to 2 stars (in my opinion). BRING BACK THE OLD ONES!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Some water can seep under the rolls when they are dry but they work great once they absorb some water. It is great that they are reasonably short. Easy to move, can configure to fit your space, and not too heavy when fully wet. They deteriorate after being out in the rain and sun for a year so store them after they dry out.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyekait

customer_reviews.title: The best water absorbent snakes around..
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the OINK brand.. they suck compared to these. Not great to reuse. But for the price, nearly half of the other brand, I am okay with a one time and done. We had a water seepage problem in our basement and needed to wait 2 months for the new basement drainage to be installed. These not only saved my finished basement from damage but saved my sanity. With the other brand they barely absorbed their limit. These snakes are almost 7lbs each when fully poofed. LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.author: SadieElvis

customer_reviews.title: From Awesome to Complete Crap!
customer_reviews.text: The first boxes of these I bought worked as stated this last box they just get wet they do not actually absorb any water. The original were light blue and absorbed thoroughly and quickly. These gray ones feel like a bait and switch. They aren't even the same material. I won't ever buy from this vendor again. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: SuzanneT

customer_reviews.title: Sock it to me!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly as promised. Had to leave for a few weeks and feared my convector air conditioning unit would leak due to clogged drainage etc... ( a building wide problem for the past several years). I left 2 socks around the unit, and the convector did leak and the sock absorbed all the water. One sock was soaked and the second was partially soaked. The leak at some point had stopped and I had no damage only removing the socks and minor clean up. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MEB

customer_reviews.title: Not a bandaid - but mess on top of a mess.
customer_reviews.text: Not a solution if you are seeking to control or contain a spill. It will absorb a small spill, but will not contain for a long duration. If you want containment, this is not the product to use. For dripping and leaks you might as well just mop it up, until it gets repaired. Because it comes in a roll you'd think it would contain a spill, it does NOT.
customer_reviews.author: G. Harden

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: These have worked very well on the small spills I've had. I purchased these as a preventative measure to address water spills around the home, such as working on toilets, sinks and heaven forbid, failed water heater.
customer_reviews.author: JStreet

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent .
customer_reviews.text: They call them super absorbent and that's exactly what they are they do a outstanding job of soaking up water.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Please, do not buy this product!!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolute garbage. I’d have been better off using towels. I am so dissatisfied. Theses are lightly filled with random fillers and don’t absorb crap. My basement flooded because I trusted this product. You should be ashamed.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpionchick

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great value
customer_reviews.text: I thought at first that because they were cheaper than other brands they may not do as well. I was wrong. I have an old leaking water heater that will be replaced soon but was making a mess in the laundry room. Boy, these were a lifesaver. It absorbed the moister quickly. When they were full, I just placed them outside to drive and reuse. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of water
customer_reviews.text: I used this to soak up water in the crawlspace so we could lay down some concrete to waterproof the area. Soaked up all the water in about 15 mins. As we moved them out of the space, they didn't even drip water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product changed
customer_reviews.text: When I first ordered these in the fall of 2019 I loved them. However, I recently ordered them again and the product has changed. They feel lighter and I believe they absorb less.
customer_reviews.author: JWilly

customer_reviews.title: Flood protection
customer_reviews.text: came quickly; protective item that soaks up water, We put it around our water heater and items in the basement as a safeguard in case of sump pump failure
customer_reviews.author: Jmori

customer_reviews.title: Kept water in check
customer_reviews.text: My boiler was starting to leak so I bought these just in case it got worse and it kept the water in check before the Plummer could fix it worked great now I use them keep the drafts out on my basement door when they get wet just put them out in the summer they will dry out to reuse
customer_reviews.author: Hugo J.

customer_reviews.title: Get the answer before purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot seem to be allowed to post a question about this product after purchase. If I cannot get an answer, I'll have to return it. Hopefully, the manufacturer will see this and respond, or some other customer may know. I live in a hot and humid area. Can I store these in the box, in my garage w/o them absorbing moisture?
customer_reviews.author: ShopGirl

customer_reviews.title: absorbency
customer_reviews.text: I was taking on a lot of water, but they did what they were suppose to do. Even though I laid them out to dry, they clumped some and dried hard! But it helps to roll them out with your foot, I lost about 1 1/2 feet of each when dry so I packed them back into shape firm. I was expecting one to burst, but non did!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: I got this for flooding into the apartment but it didn't help at all
customer_reviews.text: I used these to try and be a barrier for water as it pours in from outside but the water just flows right under it. Not very helpful and it's slow to absorb water too.
customer_reviews.author: vh7

customer_reviews.title: Protects from heavy Spring rains.
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area subject to heavy thunderstorms, and my house is slightry down slope from my neighbors. I am using these to protect my garage floor and my crawl space. I hang them out to dry, but it takes a while
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water dams that are light weight and work great
customer_reviews.text: We have an older home and the spring rain season usually means some water in our basement. These have helped and are more light weight than others we have used.
customer_reviews.author: DJacenixon83

customer_reviews.title: Drying is a pain
customer_reviews.text: Sure picks up a lot of water but having to dry them outside is a real problem. I currently have them outside for a second day, going on around 11 hours and still not dry.
customer_reviews.author: stan marshall

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for all homeowners
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price and service. We had an ice maker pop and began flooding the kitchen floor but this product saved the day. I also have some around the washer to avoid possible problems in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Dub

customer_reviews.title: woth it!
customer_reviews.text: My basement fills with water when it rains heavily. These bats fill up with so much water it's amazing and stop the whole thing from flooding. Right now I dry them out by putting them on the floor near the boiler.
customer_reviews.author: e.witz

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind while traveling!
customer_reviews.text: I had a water leak and I was stressed every time I needed to travel. I bought this product to give me peace of mind, in the event that water leaks in again. I put it around the water heater, the HVAC pump and the basement egress window, just in case. So far, no water has come in, but I can sleep better while I travel, knowing I'm more protected!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Very Absorbent
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use in our basement until we could get it waterproofed. The socks are very absorbent. I was not able to wring them out like some but that was okay with me. They aren't a cure all but were very helpful with the water flow.
customer_reviews.author: DPatel

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how well these work
customer_reviews.text: I got these a month ago and haven't had a chance to see them work yet. I live in Southern California where apparently you don't need these :)
customer_reviews.author: Craig Lindstrom

customer_reviews.title: Worst product bought so far
customer_reviews.text: They did not soak up the Water from my car being parked in the garage and letting the snow melt Water actually went right under the water stopper l
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne T Deziel Sr

customer_reviews.title: Does not dry out and bunches up into balls
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! I purchased two different brands and this one is really only good for one use then throw it ot!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Take up a lot of moisture & help keep water out of basement!
customer_reviews.text: These have worked perfectly for helping to keep water out of our basement! Way better than dealing with sand bags
customer_reviews.author: Debbie b.

customer_reviews.title: Nope- Grab a towel instead
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful after reading reviews but these are terrible! A rolled up towel would work better :(
customer_reviews.author: Toni Tails

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform as indicated
customer_reviews.text: One bursted open before use. Not very absorbent. Water ran under them. Had to put other clothes down to assist with absorption
customer_reviews.author: Tya Smile

customer_reviews.title: Very Absorbant!! Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these water Snakes before and they work great!! I recommend them to everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay D

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Same as expected. Product received in good condition. Quality is good, it works as intended. Value for money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C

customer_reviews.title: Contains the water.
customer_reviews.text: have only had the product for short time; however, they appear to be working as advertised. Not sure how long they will last, but so far, absorbing water from slow leaking drain pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Texican

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.  Absorbent pads were best
customer_reviews.text: Absorb a lot of water but hard to dry out. They burst open easy making a huge mess.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Soaks up liquid quickly and guides water to drain if necessary. Also used to prevent moisture
customer_reviews.author: Jay A. Nolte

customer_reviews.title: Work great against machine edges or near doors/walls
customer_reviews.text: Never like to need them but when a spill happens these things are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Louis Lovasco

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! Returning ASAP these are such a waste of money and do t help at all with soaking up water like they claim. Not only did I waste time and money but I have to kee vacuuming up the water until the hvac guys here these are horrible
customer_reviews.author: ashwee

customer_reviews.title: i don't know
customer_reviews.text: i have not had to use them yet, but im am hoping they work
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying....
customer_reviews.text: The outer cover disintegrated in less than 90 days and it never got wet ...terrible product....don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia Harris

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Absorbency could be better but good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Absorbed lot's of water and easy to move afterwards  to dry out!
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic! It's by far the easiest method I've ever encountered to clean up standing water ! I loved the product so much I purchased another order, because of the excessive amounts of snow we had this Winter.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wendlandt

customer_reviews.title: SOLVED A SERIOUS PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: VERY USEFUL TECHNOLOGY, FIRST SAY IT IN USE IN SOUTH DAKOTA
customer_reviews.author: white tiger

customer_reviews.title: Good to have.
customer_reviews.text: This was great. I already had some flooding I. The basement. So this helps protect the hard to reach areas.
customer_reviews.author: Yellagirl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: One and done, I hoped they would dry out and they could use them again. No such luck
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this product is amazing. I have a leak in my basement, the central air unit. It absorbs all the water. It last for about 2-3 weeks. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Priscella Russell

customer_reviews.title: Used for patio
customer_reviews.text: We have a covered patio where water pools after it rains. These worked well in absorbing the water. They dry in the sun quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B. Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Water seeped out
customer_reviews.text: When it filled with water it didi not create a barrier but leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan65

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep basements dry!
customer_reviews.text: We lined these up around our basement walls. Neighbors got super flooded and we barely got anything thanks to these!
customer_reviews.author: Kallie Obray

customer_reviews.title: Keep these for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Our ubit was flooded and our neighbors gave us 3. We were so impressed we bought a dozen which were used 3 weeks later when we flooded again! A bargain and fabulous product
customer_reviews.author: susan m jones walker

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This was a repeat purchase. I can recommend these for water leaking into the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my water bed. Had a leak that was patched and the pillows absorbed the water in the box frame around the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: R.J.Allen

customer_reviews.title: seem to work fine
customer_reviews.text: I just put these out, so I haven't had long enough to make sure they are exactly what I need, but so far they are doing the job!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use initially but once they are wet. They are very very slimy, stink. I used them around a basement shower that drain can't keep up. Took outside for several days & still didn't dry out, so I just threw in trash & called plumber to fix drain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 boxes of socks. The products in the two boxes are NOT identical. They didn't absorb as advertised either. I returned BOTH boxes but have only received an refund for 1 of the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: decent product
customer_reviews.text: smaller than photo shows buy can be used as described
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best Product
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have a way to press the item against the window sill, it doesn't absorb any moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Almand

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. Yes it does absorb water. No you can’t spin it out in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: A. McAvaney

customer_reviews.title: unable to judge
customer_reviews.text: Unable to judge it's effective abilities as of this time since no major rain
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Lieberman

customer_reviews.title: Undecided
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them yet, but they look cheaply made. They would not be able to be used more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Gina v.

customer_reviews.title: great and useful
customer_reviews.text: use for a garage floor that rain water seems to collect on
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for hurricane season and believe it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalina

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Very absorbent product. I recommend this to anyone who has liquid spill problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jean H.

customer_reviews.title: Doing what it should. Happy buyer.
customer_reviews.text: Great product doing a wonderful job. What more can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Steve C.

customer_reviews.title: You can continuously use and reuse this product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing it eliminated my task of pumping water out of my basement wherever there's a flood.
customer_reviews.author: Val P

customer_reviews.title: good absorbent
customer_reviews.text: For best results this product can only be used once.
customer_reviews.author: JIM R.

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Used these in my car for water and they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R.

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent! Our basement always gets water and it spreads ...
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent! Our basement always gets water and it spreads across the room. We used these and the water stayed right where it comes in at and these soaked up the water! Definitely recommend these and I will be keeping these in stock for lots of rain days or weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product I have ever purchased - from anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Lin Cobb

product_meta.title: NPS Spill Control | Mildew-Resistant Absorbent Sock | Water Absorbing Snake | 3" x 48" | 1-Gal Absorbency | Pack of 12 | 12GS34
feature_bullets: WATER ABSORBER SOCK absorbs leaks, spills and condensation
FLEXIBLE ABSORBENT SOCK is ideal for placing under freezers and coolers, along walls and surrounding equipment
NPS Spill Control ABSORBENT SOCKS are perfect for basement and garage use – easy to clean up any leak
MILDEW RESISTANT ABSORBENT SOCK is made of 100% polypropylene skin and filler, resisting the growth of mildew and mold
WATER ABSORBING SNAKE is lightweight and designed to quickly absorb and retain water (not recommended for diking large volumes of liquid)
